snippet: President François Hollande said, “France is at war,” as security forces in France and Belgium zeroed in on a man they call the architect of the assault.
abstract: French Pres Francois Holland issues call to arms, telling Parliament 'France is at war' and asking it for quick action to help eradicate Islamic State; security forces close in on Belgian suspect Abdelhamid Abaaoud, radical jihadist they think was leader of Paris terrorist attacks.

byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN, KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA and KATRIN BENNHOLD
byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden reported from Paris, Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from Brussels and Katrin Bennhold from London. Reporting was contributed by Julie Carriat, Andrew Higgins, James Kanter and Milan Schreuer from Brussels; Lilia Blaise, Elian Peltier and Rukmini Callimachi from Paris; Stephen Castle, Palko Karasz and Madeleine Kruhly from London; Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt from Washington; Michael D. Shear and Ceylan Yeginsu from Antalya, Turkey; and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: President François Hollande said, “France is at war,” as security forces in France and Belgium zeroed in on a man they call the architect of the assault.

headline.main: Call to Arms in France Amid Hunt for Belgian Suspect in Paris Attacks
headline.print_headline: Call to Arms in France Amid Raid and Hunt for Belgian Suspect in Attacks

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
